news.title: Government to take call on housing board project at Cuncolim: Goa CM
news.para: The Goa government has not yet decided on a housing board project at Panzorconi in Cuncolim. Local opposition leader Yuri Alemao raised concerns about the project's impact on the village's social fabric, sports grounds, heritage, and environment. Chief Minister Pramod Sawant assured that all stakeholders will be consulted before any decision is made.

news.title: Goa: Court quashes Unity Mall’s construction licence in Chimbel
news.para: A district court has quashed the construction licence for Goa Tourism Development Corporation's Unity Mall project in Chimbel. This decision follows a two-week protest by residents concerned about the project's impact on the ecologically vital Toyyar Lake. The court's ruling overturned previous orders that had compelled the local panchayat to issue the licence.

news.title: Kolkata: 10 New Town residential plots up for e-auction
news.para: The West Bengal government is boosting residential development in New Town by e-auctioning 10 large plots, totaling approximately 4.7 acres, on a freehold basis. These plots, ranging from 1,500 to 2,000 sq m, are located in Action Area II and will be auctioned next month. This initiative aims to further expand housing options within the planned township.

news.title: Mohali development body starts e-auction of 42 prime sites worth ₹5,460 crore
news.para: Greater Mohali Area Development Authority (Gmada) will auction 42 prime sites worth Rs 5,460 crore from January 14 to February 11. This online mega e-auction aims to rationalize property prices, ensure transparency, and attract investors for residential, commercial, and institutional development. The initiative is part of the state government's strategy for planned urban development and economic growth.

news.title: Lucknow civic body cracks down to get house tax dues
news.para: The Lucknow Municipal Corporation (LMC) conducted a citywide house tax recovery drive, sealing and attaching numerous residential and commercial properties across multiple zones. This enforcement action against defaulters, including a building on Naval Kishore Road and shops in Sai Market, aimed to boost revenue. The drive resulted in significant collections and a stern warning to those with pending dues.

news.title: Maharashtra: SRA norms tightened to mandate freezing sale flats to secure rehab dues
news.para: The Slum Rehabilitation Authority (SRA) has mandated early-stage freezing of free-sale inventory in slum redevelopment projects. This move aims to secure transit rent payments and permanent alternate accommodation obligations for eligible slum dwellers. Developers must now formally earmark and list these frozen flats, limiting their sale or encumbrance until rehabilitation is complete and all dues are cleared.

news.title: Karnataka RERA asks builder to file compliance plan for Mysuru project
news.para: After 19 complaints, K-RERA set a 30-day deadline for a Haryana developer to detail completed works, pending amenities, timelines, and statutory compliances, failing which Section 63 penalties may follow apply

news.title: Vietnam plans tax policies to tackle speculation in real estate market
news.para: Vietnam is taking bold steps to tackle the housing crisis as skyrocketing property prices make it increasingly difficult for the average citizen to afford a home. New tax policies are on the drawing board, aimed at curbing speculative buying and promoting fair housing opportunities.

news.title: Rainwater harvesting mandatory for large buildings in Goa: Water resources minister
news.para: Goa has introduced a new regulation mandating rooftop rainwater harvesting systems for substantial residential, commercial, and government structures. This initiative is set to bolster water conservation throughout the region.

news.title: Mangaluru civic body conducts drives to clear illegal buildings in city
news.para: Mangaluru City Corporation is actively demolishing illegal buildings. An unauthorized house in Alape village was torn down for violating building plans and using ground-floor parking space. Officials confirmed demolition drives will continue to clear unauthorized constructions. The corporation will take action against future violations that affect the city's well-being. Legal challenges may cause delays in future drives.

news.title: UK: Vistry's home sales fell 9% in 2025
news.para: Vistry, the UK home development firm, is predicting a dip in profit margins for 2025, as home sales continue to decline. The current market uncertainty is causing hesitance among private buyers and complicating social housing agreements.

news.title: M3M India, Smartworld Developers tie up with ELIE SAAB for ₹3,500-crore housing projects in NCR
news.para: M3M India and Smartworld Developers are bringing ELIE SAAB to Indian real estate. They will develop two ultra-luxury residential projects in Delhi-NCR. One project is in Gurugram with large four-bedroom apartments. The other is in Noida, offering a mix of apartment sizes.

news.title: Ajmera Realty posts ₹1,431 crore sales in first nine months of FY26
news.para: Ajmera Realty & Infra India has achieved significant growth. Sales for the first nine months of FY26 reached ₹1,431 crore, a 72% increase year-on-year. The company is set to surpass its full-year sales target of ₹1,600 crore.

news.title: Tulip Infratech posts ₹450 crore turnover in FY25; profits rise to ₹80–90 crore
news.para: In FY25, Tulip Infratech proudly reported a ₹450 crore turnover with profits ranging from ₹80-90 crore. This year, they are maintaining an optimistic outlook, expecting steady revenue and margins between 10-20 percent. By adhering to a prudent operational model that limits them to four active projects at any one time, they effectively manage risk.

news.title: Executive Centre India receives SEBI approval for ₹2,600-crore IPO
news.para: Executive Centre India has obtained SEBI's approval for its Initial Public Offering, setting the stage to raise ₹2,600 crore via fresh equity shares. The funds are earmarked for acquiring TEC locations in Singapore and Dubai, demonstrating a bold internal restructuring strategy.

news.title: Puravankara reports pre-sales of ₹1,414 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: In the third quarter of FY26, Puravankara reported pre-sales of ₹1,414 crore and collections totaling ₹1,140 crore. The firm made a significant leap in its portfolio by incorporating new projects valued at ₹13,900 crore in both Bengaluru and Mumbai. During this period, the company delivered 1.23 million sq ft of space.

news.title: HC upholds Bengaluru development body's land acquisition for Banashankari VI Stage
news.para: The High Court has upheld the Bangalore Development Authority's (BDA) land acquisition for the Banashankari VI Stage extension. Dismissing appeals, the court found the acquisition process lawful and fair, noting substantial implementation of the development scheme. The bench emphasized that urban expansion and public interest outweighed individual claims.

news.title: Telangana HC dismisses Union Bank of India’s appeal over property auction
news.para: The Telangana High Court has dismissed the Union Bank of India's appeal. The court found the bank failed to follow proper legal procedures during an auction. A property belonging to a city-based company under liquidation was sold for a lower price.

news.title: Ghaziabad development body cuts interest rate on properties
news.para: Ghaziabad Development Authority (GDA) has reduced its property interest rate from 10.7% to 8.7%, aligning with the State Bank of India's rates as mandated by the state government. This move, along with a reduced EMI penalty from 3% to 2%, aims to boost consumer sentiment and accelerate the sale of 1,748 unsold dwelling units.

news.title: Court rules zero GST on transfer of MIDC plots to third party
news.para: Businesses transferring MIDC plots to a third party will not attract GST. The Nagpur bench of the Bombay High Court upheld this decision. This ruling provides relief to many businesses facing GST notices. The court followed a Gujarat High Court precedent. This clarifies a long-standing tax ambiguity for genuine business transfers across Maharashtra.
